intro: Dryandra plumosa, commonly known as the silky dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, fluffy, pinkish-white flowers that appear in late summer. The plant has narrow, needle-like leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal heathlands. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a notable species in the region's flora.
